prompts.title: Market Research Analysis
prompts.description: Deep dive into any market niche to uncover opportunities, sizing, and trends
prompts.prompt:
Act as a market research analyst. Analyze the {{niche}} market comprehensively.

Provide:
1. Market size (current + projected 3-year)
2. Top 5 players and their positioning
3. Primary customer pain points (ranked by severity)
4. Pricing benchmarks across tiers
5. Underserved segments and white-space opportunities
6. AI/automation disruption potential in this space
7. Top 3 entry strategies for a new player

Format as a structured report with actionable insights. Be specific, not generic.
prompts.use_case: Use before entering a new market or launching a new offer

prompts.title: Competitor Deep Dive
prompts.description: Analyze any competitor's full strategy to find gaps you can exploit
prompts.prompt:
Act as a competitive intelligence analyst. Conduct a deep analysis of {{competitor}}.

Cover:
1. Business model and revenue streams
2. Pricing strategy and positioning
3. Marketing channels and messaging
4. Product/service strengths and gaps
5. Customer sentiment (what reviews reveal)
6. Team and operational weaknesses
7. Your top 5 differentiation opportunities

Be specific. Identify actionable gaps I can target.
prompts.use_case: Use to position yourself against established players

prompts.title: Pricing Strategy Builder
prompts.description: Build a value-based pricing model for any offer
prompts.prompt:
Act as a pricing strategist. Help me price {{offer}} for {{target_customer}}.

Analyze:
1. Value delivered vs. cost of the problem unsolved
2. Competitor pricing landscape
3. Tiered pricing options (3 packages: entry, core, premium)
4. Psychological pricing tactics that apply
5. Price anchoring strategy
6. Recommended price points with rationale
7. How to justify the price to skeptical buyers

Provide specific numbers, not ranges. Be decisive.
prompts.use_case: Use when launching a new offer or repositioning an existing one

prompts.title: Business Plan Generator
prompts.description: Generate a concise, actionable business plan for any AI venture
prompts.prompt:
Act as a startup business strategist. Create a lean business plan for {{business_idea}} targeting {{market}}.

Include:
1. Problem statement and solution
2. Target customer persona (specific)
3. Revenue model and pricing
4. Go-to-market strategy (first 90 days)
5. Key milestones: 30/60/90 days
6. Revenue projections: Month 1-6
7. Core risks and mitigation strategies
8. Resources needed to launch

Make this executable by a solo operator. Keep it lean and action-focused.
prompts.use_case: Use before launching any new venture to validate the model

prompts.title: Niche Finder and Validator
prompts.description: Find and validate the perfect niche for your AI services business
prompts.prompt:
Act as a niche strategy consultant. Help me identify and validate a profitable niche for {{service_type}} services.

Process:
1. Generate 10 niche candidates
2. Score each on: demand (1-10), competition (1-10 inversely), willingness to pay (1-10), AI leverage (1-10)
3. Identify top 3 niches with highest combined score
4. For the #1 niche: ideal client avatar, primary pain points, how to reach them, average project value
5. Validation checklist (5 steps to confirm before committing)

Be specific. Name industries, job titles, business types.
prompts.use_case: Use when starting out or pivoting to a new market

prompts.title: Revenue Model Designer
prompts.description: Design multiple revenue streams for maximum income stability
prompts.prompt:
Act as a revenue architect. Design a multi-stream revenue model for {{business_type}} in {{niche}}.

Create 4 revenue streams:
1. Primary (high-ticket, low-volume)
2. Recurring (subscription or retainer)
3. Passive/scalable (productized or digital)
4. Quick-cash (done-for-you service)

For each stream: price point, volume needed for ${{monthly_goal}}/month, effort to set up (1-10), time to first dollar.

5. 90-day roadmap to activate all 4 streams

Prioritize by fastest path to cash first.
prompts.use_case: Use to diversify income and reduce reliance on one revenue source

prompts.title: SWOT Analysis Builder
prompts.description: Run a strategic SWOT analysis on your business or idea
prompts.prompt:
Act as a business strategist. Conduct a detailed SWOT analysis for {{business_or_idea}}.

For each quadrant, provide 5-7 specific items:
STRENGTHS: Genuine competitive advantages
WEAKNESSES: Honest internal limitations
OPPORTUNITIES: External trends and market gaps
THREATS: Real risks that could derail success

Then provide:
- Top 3 SO strategies (use strengths to grab opportunities)
- Top 3 WT strategies (minimize weaknesses to avoid threats)
- Priority actions for the next 30 days

Be brutally honest, not flattering.
prompts.use_case: Use quarterly for strategic planning and decision-making

prompts.title: Offer Validation Framework
prompts.description: Validate any offer before investing time and money building it
prompts.prompt:
Act as a product validation expert. Help me validate {{offer_idea}} before building it.

Validation checklist:
1. Problem clarity: Is it real, urgent, and expensive?
2. Customer existence: Who exactly has this problem?
3. Willingness to pay: Evidence of spending in this space
4. Competition check: What exists, and why would mine win?
5. Distribution channel: How do I reach these buyers?
6. MVP definition: Smallest version I can sell in 14 days
7. Pre-sell test: Script to validate with 10 real conversations
8. Kill criteria: What would make this not worth pursuing?

Give me a go/no-go recommendation with reasoning.
prompts.use_case: Use before building any new product or service

prompts.title: 90-Day Growth Sprint Plan
prompts.description: Build a focused 90-day plan to hit a specific business milestone
prompts.prompt:
Act as a business growth strategist. Create a 90-day sprint plan to achieve: {{goal}}

Current state: {{current_state}}
Available time: {{hours_per_week}} hours/week
Budget: ${{budget}}

Deliver:
1. THE SINGLE BIG MOVE: One primary initiative that drives 80% of results
2. MONTH 1 (Foundation): Week 1-2 priorities, Week 3-4 priorities, Month 1 milestone
3. MONTH 2 (Momentum): Key activities, Month 2 milestone
4. MONTH 3 (Scale): Key activities, Month 3 milestone
5. WEEKLY CADENCE: What to do every week without exception
6. WHAT TO STOP DOING: 3 things to cut immediately
7. SUCCESS DEFINITION: How I know I hit the goal

Make it aggressive but realistic for one person.
prompts.use_case: Use at the start of every quarter to set focused priorities

prompts.title: Service Productization Blueprint
prompts.description: Turn a custom service into a scalable productized offer
prompts.prompt:
Act as a business model consultant. Help me productize {{service}} into a scalable offer.

Current delivery: {{current_delivery}}
Average client: {{average_client}}
Time per client: {{time_per_client}}
Current price: ${{current_price}}

Create:
1. THE PRODUCTIZED OFFER: Name, scope, and clear deliverables
2. WHAT'S INCLUDED: Specific list
3. WHAT'S NOT INCLUDED: Clear boundaries
4. DELIVERY PROCESS: Step-by-step, time-boxed
5. PRICING STRUCTURE: Fixed price or package options
6. TURNAROUND TIME: Standard timeline
7. HOW TO SCALE: Handle 5x clients with same or less time
8. POSITIONING STATEMENT: One sentence description

Goal: Sell the same thing to everyone, deliver with minimal customization.
prompts.use_case: Use to stop selling custom work and start selling systems

prompts.title: Ideal Client Avatar Builder
prompts.description: Build a hyper-specific ideal client profile that drives all marketing decisions
prompts.prompt:
Act as a market research expert. Build a detailed ideal client avatar for {{business_type}} offering {{service}}.

Create a profile covering:
1. DEMOGRAPHICS: Age, location, income, job title, company size
2. PSYCHOGRAPHICS: Values, beliefs, aspirations, fears
3. DAILY REALITY: What their typical day looks like
4. PAIN HIERARCHY: Top 3 problems (primary, secondary, symptomatic)
5. DECISION TRIGGERS: What makes them buy NOW vs. later
6. OBJECTION MINDSET: What holds them back from buying
7. INFORMATION DIET: Where they consume content
8. LANGUAGE PATTERNS: Exact words they use to describe their problem
9. TRANSFORMATION DESIRE: Where they want to be in 6-12 months
10. SUCCESS STORY: Write a 150-word before/after narrative for this person

Give this person a name and make them feel real.
prompts.use_case: Use as the foundation for all marketing copy and targeting decisions

prompts.title: Strategic Partnership Blueprint
prompts.description: Identify and structure strategic partnerships to accelerate growth
prompts.prompt:
Act as a business development strategist. Design a strategic partnership program for {{business}} in {{niche}}.

Target partnership type: {{partnership_type}} (referral/co-creation/affiliate/JV)
What I offer partners: {{value_to_partners}}
What I need from partners: {{what_I_need}}

Deliver:
1. IDEAL PARTNER PROFILE: Exactly who to target
2. PARTNER OUTREACH SCRIPT: Email + DM templates
3. PARTNERSHIP AGREEMENT STRUCTURE: What to offer, what to ask
4. VALUE EXCHANGE: How both parties win
5. COMMISSION/COMPENSATION STRUCTURE
6. ACTIVATION PLAN: How to keep partners engaged and producing
7. PARTNER ONBOARDING: 5-step process
8. TRACKING SYSTEM: How to measure partner performance
9. 90-DAY GOAL: Realistic target for first quarter

Make the partnership offer irresistible to the right partners.
prompts.use_case: Use to build a referral and partnership network

prompts.title: Annual Planning Workshop Guide
prompts.description: Run a comprehensive annual business planning session
prompts.prompt:
Act as a strategic planning facilitator. Guide me through an annual planning workshop for {{business}}.

Previous year revenue: ${{prev_revenue}}
Next year revenue goal: ${{next_year_goal}}
Team size: {{team_size}}

Workshop agenda:
1. YEAR IN REVIEW (30 min): What worked, what didn't, biggest lessons
2. MARKET LANDSCAPE (20 min): How has the market changed?
3. STRATEGIC PRIORITIES (40 min): Top 3 initiatives for the year
4. RESOURCE ALLOCATION (20 min): Budget and time allocation per initiative
5. QUARTERLY MILESTONES: 4 quarterly targets
6. ONE-WORD THEME: The word that captures the year's focus
7. ANTI-GOALS: What you will NOT do this year
8. ACCOUNTABILITY STRUCTURE: How to stay on track all year

Include guiding questions for each section.
prompts.use_case: Use every December/January for annual strategic planning

prompts.title: Exit Strategy Planner
prompts.description: Plan a business exit or acquisition strategy
prompts.prompt:
Act as an M&A advisor. Create an exit strategy for {{business}} with current revenue of ${{annual_revenue}}.

Desired exit timeline: {{timeline}}
Exit type: {{exit_type}} (acquisition/merger/sellout/succession)
Target exit valuation: ${{target_valuation}}

Deliver:
1. CURRENT VALUATION ESTIMATE: Multiple analysis for this business type
2. VALUE DRIVERS: What increases valuation most in this business category
3. VALUE DETRACTORS: What's currently reducing valuation
4. 24-MONTH PREP PLAN: How to maximize value before exit
5. BUYER TYPES: Who would want to acquire this business and why
6. CLEAN-UP CHECKLIST: Financial, legal, operational items to address
7. DOCUMENTATION NEEDED: What buyers will ask for
8. BROKER VS. DIRECT: When to use each

Be realistic about valuation. Most online businesses sell for 2-4x annual profit.
prompts.use_case: Use when planning to sell or step back from a business

prompts.title: YouTube Script Writer
prompts.description: Generate high-retention YouTube video scripts with proven hooks
prompts.prompt:
Act as a top YouTube scriptwriter. Write a full script for a {{length}}-minute video titled: {{title}}

Target audience: {{audience}}
Tone: {{tone}}

Structure:
[HOOK - 30 sec]: Pattern interrupt + bold claim + reason to keep watching
[CONTEXT - 1 min]: Who you are, why qualified, what they'll get
[MAIN CONTENT]: 3-5 key points, each with: claim, story/proof, application
[MIDPOINT PATTERN INTERRUPT]: Re-engage with question or surprising stat
[CTA]: Specific ask tied to their transformation

Include: [B-ROLL suggestions], timestamps, and thumbnail concept.
Make the hook the strongest part.
prompts.use_case: Use for any YouTube video to maximize retention and engagement

prompts.title: Newsletter Issue Writer
prompts.description: Write engaging newsletters that readers actually open and click
prompts.prompt:
Act as a newsletter copywriter. Write an issue about: {{topic}}

Audience: {{audience}}
Goal: {{goal}}
Word count: {{word_count}}

Deliverables:
1. Subject lines (5 options: curiosity, benefit, urgency, personal, contrarian)
2. Preview text (90 chars max)
3. Opening hook (the sentence that makes them keep reading)
4. Main content (story-driven, one core insight)
5. Actionable takeaways (3-5 bullets)
6. Resource of the week
7. CTA (one clear ask)
8. P.S. line

Write conversationally. No corporate speak.
prompts.use_case: Use for weekly newsletter sends to your list

prompts.title: SEO Blog Article
prompts.description: Write SEO-optimized blog posts that rank and convert
prompts.prompt:
Act as an SEO content strategist and writer. Write a comprehensive blog post:

Topic: {{topic}}
Primary keyword: {{keyword}}
Target length: {{word_count}} words
Tone: {{tone}}

Structure:
- SEO title (under 60 chars, keyword near front)
- Meta description (under 155 chars with CTA)
- H1 heading
- Introduction (hook + problem + promise)
- 4-6 H2 sections with H3 subsections
- Internal link placeholders [LINK: topic]
- FAQ section (5 questions)
- Conclusion with CTA

Optimize for featured snippets where possible.
prompts.use_case: Use for blog content that drives organic traffic

prompts.title: Twitter/X Thread Creator
prompts.description: Write viral Twitter/X threads that grow your following fast
prompts.prompt:
Act as a viral Twitter/X strategist. Write a high-engagement thread about: {{topic}}

Audience: {{audience}}
Goal: {{goal}}

Thread structure:
Tweet 1 (HOOK): Bold claim or contrarian take. End with 'Thread.'
Tweets 2-8: One insight per tweet. Specific, counterintuitive, with data or examples.
Tweet 9: Recap tweet (best insights)
Tweet 10 (CTA): Specific ask + why to follow you

Rules:
- Each tweet under 280 chars
- No filler. Every tweet earns its spot.
- Number each tweet (1/10, 2/10, etc.)

Make tweet 1 so compelling they MUST read the rest.
prompts.use_case: Use to build authority and grow your Twitter/X following

prompts.title: LinkedIn Post Writer
prompts.description: Write LinkedIn posts that generate leads and build B2B authority
prompts.use_case: Use 3-5x per week to build a consistent LinkedIn presence

prompts.title: TikTok Script Writer
prompts.description: Write fast-paced TikTok scripts optimized for watch time and shares
prompts.prompt:
Act as a TikTok content creator. Write a script for a {{duration}}-second TikTok.

Topic: {{topic}}
Hook style: {{hook_style}}
Target audience: {{target_audience}}

Script:
[0-3 sec HOOK]: Most attention-grabbing thing first. No intros.
[4-15 sec SETUP]: Brief context. Why should they care?
[16-{{duration}} sec CONTENT]: Fast-paced value. One idea every 3-5 seconds.
[Final 3 sec CTA]: Follow + comment prompt

Include:
- Text overlay suggestions [TEXT: ...]
- Caption (150 chars) + hashtags
- B-roll/visual notes
prompts.use_case: Use for TikTok content to grow a new or existing account

prompts.title: Podcast Episode Outline
prompts.description: Create structured podcast episode outlines with talking points
prompts.prompt:
Act as a podcast producer. Create a full episode outline for:

Episode title: {{title}}
Guest/topic: {{guest_or_topic}}
Length: {{length}} minutes
Format: {{format}}

Include:
1. Pre-roll hook (30-second teaser)
2. Intro talking points
3. 4-6 main segments: title, key questions, desired insight, transition
4. Lightning round (5 questions)
5. Closing + guest CTA
6. Outro CTA
7. 5 alternative episode titles
8. Episode description (200 words for podcast platforms)

Make transitions smooth and natural.
prompts.use_case: Use before every recording session

prompts.title: Email Subject Line Generator
prompts.description: Generate high-open-rate email subject lines for any campaign
prompts.prompt:
Act as an email marketing expert. Generate 20 subject lines for an email about: {{email_topic}}

Audience: {{audience}}
Goal: {{goal}}

Generate 4 subject lines for each style:
1. Curiosity gap
2. Benefit-forward
3. Controversy/contrarian
4. Personalization hook
5. Urgency/scarcity

For each: preview text (under 90 chars) + open rate prediction (high/medium/low).

Flag top 3 to A/B test first.
prompts.use_case: Use before every email send to maximize open rates

prompts.title: Content Repurposing Engine
prompts.description: Turn one piece of content into 10+ assets across platforms
prompts.prompt:
Act as a content repurposing strategist. Take this content and repurpose it into 10+ formats:

Original content: {{original_content}}
Original format: {{original_format}}
Core message: {{core_message}}

Repurpose into:
1. Twitter/X thread (10 tweets)
2. LinkedIn post (250 words)
3. Instagram carousel (8 slides - headlines only)
4. TikTok script (60 seconds)
5. Email newsletter excerpt (150 words)
6. YouTube description + timestamps
7. 5 quotable insights
8. Blog post intro paragraph
9. Podcast talking points (5 bullets)
10. Pinterest pin headline + description

Adapt tone per platform ‚Äî don't copy-paste.
prompts.use_case: Use after creating any long-form content to maximize ROI

prompts.title: Instagram Caption Writer
prompts.description: Write engaging Instagram captions that drive saves, shares, and follows
prompts.use_case: Use for every Instagram post to maximize reach

prompts.title: Email Nurture Sequence Builder
prompts.description: Write a full 7-email nurture sequence for any lead magnet or product
prompts.prompt:
Act as an email marketing strategist. Create a 7-email nurture sequence for {{product_or_lead_magnet}}.

Subscriber origin: {{traffic_source}}
Goal: {{goal}}
Offer: {{offer}} at ${{price}}

Sequence:
Email 1 (Immediate): Welcome + deliver + set expectations
Email 2 (Day 2): Best content. No ask. Build trust.
Email 3 (Day 4): Your story/origin.
Email 4 (Day 6): Social proof + case study
Email 5 (Day 8): Pivot to the problem your offer solves
Email 6 (Day 10): Present the offer + bonuses
Email 7 (Day 12): Urgency close

For each: subject line (3 options), preview text, full body, CTA.
prompts.use_case: Use for any new lead magnet or product funnel

prompts.title: Long-Form Content Blueprint
prompts.description: Plan and outline pillar content pieces that drive authority and SEO
prompts.prompt:
Act as a content strategist. Create a complete blueprint for a long-form content piece on: {{topic}}

Format: {{format}}
Primary keyword: {{keyword}}
Target length: {{word_count}} words
Brand angle: {{brand_angle}}

Deliver:
1. HEADLINE OPTIONS (5 with numbers, emotion, power words)
2. CONTENT OUTLINE: Full H2/H3 hierarchy
3. HOOK PARAGRAPH: First 100 words
4. DATA POINTS TO INCLUDE
5. VISUALS NEEDED: Charts, screenshots, diagrams
6. CONVERSION ELEMENTS: Where to place CTAs
7. PROMOTION PLAN: Where to share after publishing
8. REPURPOSING PLAN: 5 derivative pieces from this one asset

This piece should become the definitive resource on the topic.
prompts.use_case: Use for quarterly content pillars that drive compounding traffic

prompts.title: Brand Voice Style Guide Creator
prompts.description: Build a brand voice guide that keeps all content consistent
prompts.prompt:
Act as a brand strategist. Create a comprehensive brand voice style guide for {{brand_name}} in {{industry}}.

Brand personality: {{personality_adjectives}}
Target audience: {{audience}}
Competitor voices to avoid: {{competitors}}

Create:
1. BRAND VOICE STATEMENT: 1-paragraph description of how the brand sounds
2. PERSONALITY TRAITS: 4 adjectives + what each means in practice
3. TONE SPECTRUM: How tone shifts by context (social vs. sales vs. support)
4. VOCABULARY GUIDE:
   - Words we love and use often
   - Words we never use
   - Jargon to use vs. avoid
5. WRITING RULES: 10 specific do's and don'ts
6. EXAMPLE TRANSFORMATIONS: 5 before/after copy examples
7. SOCIAL MEDIA VOICE: Platform-specific adjustments
8. CTA LANGUAGE: Approved call-to-action phrases

Format for easy use by writers, marketers, and AI tools.
prompts.use_case: Use to align all content creators and AI tools to your brand

prompts.title: Video Content Strategy Builder
prompts.description: Design a full video content strategy across YouTube, TikTok, and Reels
prompts.prompt:
Act as a video content strategist. Design a multi-platform video strategy for {{creator_or_brand}} in {{niche}}.

Current platforms: {{platforms}}
Content creation capacity: {{hours_per_week}} hours/week
Goal: {{goal}}

Create:
1. PLATFORM HIERARCHY: Primary vs. secondary platform (with reasoning)
2. CONTENT PILLARS: 4 repeatable series formats
3. FOR EACH PLATFORM:
   - Optimal video length
   - Posting frequency
   - Best content types
   - Native features to leverage
4. VIDEO PRODUCTION WORKFLOW: From idea to published
5. REPURPOSING MAP: How one video becomes content on all platforms
6. GROWTH TACTICS: Platform-specific growth levers
7. MONETIZATION PATH: How video content converts to revenue
8. 90-DAY CONTENT PLAN: Week-by-week themes and formats

Design for a creator with limited time who needs to maximize output.
prompts.use_case: Use when building or scaling a video content presence

prompts.title: Thought Leadership Article Builder
prompts.description: Write thought leadership articles that establish you as an industry authority
prompts.prompt:
Act as a thought leadership ghostwriter. Write a thought leadership article for {{author}} in {{industry}}.

Unique perspective: {{perspective}}
Target publication: {{publication}}
Target length: {{word_count}} words

Article structure:
1. PROVOCATIVE HEADLINE: Challenge conventional wisdom
2. OPENING HOOK: A story, stat, or scene that opens with tension
3. THE CONVENTIONAL WISDOM: What most people believe
4. THE COUNTER-NARRATIVE: Your unique POV and why it's right
5. THE EVIDENCE: 3 supporting points (data, examples, reasoning)
6. THE IMPLICATION: What this means for the reader
7. THE CALL TO ARMS: Challenge readers to act or think differently

Tone: Authoritative but not arrogant. Contrarian without being inflammatory.
Avoid: Obvious advice, listicles, and 'in conclusion'.
prompts.use_case: Use for Forbes, LinkedIn articles, or industry publication submissions

prompts.title: Ghostwriting Service Prompt Pack
prompts.description: Complete prompt system for delivering ghostwriting services to clients
prompts.prompt:
Act as a professional ghostwriter. I need a complete content pack for {{client_name}} in {{industry}}.

Client voice sample: {{voice_sample}}
Platform: {{platform}}
Content type: {{content_type}}
Quantity needed: {{quantity}}

For each piece, write in first person as if I am {{client_name}}:
1. VOICE MATCHING: Identify 3 voice characteristics from sample
2. CONTENT PIECES: Write {{quantity}} pieces matching:
   - Their vocabulary level
   - Their typical sentence structure
   - Their personality quirks
   - Their professional expertise level
3. REVISION NOTES: What to look for to make it sound more authentic
4. APPROVAL CHECKLIST: How client can verify it sounds like them

Note: This is for content the client will publish under their name with their full knowledge and approval.
prompts.use_case: Use when providing ghostwriting services to clients

prompts.title: Cold Email Sequence
prompts.description: Write a high-converting 5-email cold outreach sequence
prompts.prompt:
Act as a sales copywriter. Write a 5-email cold outreach sequence for {{target}} offering {{service}}.

My credibility: {{credibility}}

Email 1 (Day 1) - Pure value, no pitch:
- Subject lines (3 options)
- Body: Identify their pain, offer one insight. Zero ask.

Email 2 (Day 3) - Social proof:
- Subject lines (3 options)
- Body: Case study or result. Soft mention of service.

Email 3 (Day 6) - The pitch:
- Subject lines (3 options)
- Body: Clear offer, clear ask, easy reply.

Email 4 (Day 10) - Breakup:
- Body: Pattern interrupt. Create urgency.

Email 5 (Day 14) - Final:
- Body: Lightest touch, leave door open.

Tone: Human, not salesy.
prompts.use_case: Use for any cold B2B outreach campaign

prompts.title: DM Outreach Script
prompts.description: Write non-sleazy DM scripts that actually get responses
prompts.prompt:
Act as a social selling expert. Write DM outreach scripts for {{platform}} targeting {{prospect_type}} for {{service}}.

Create 3 DM variations:
1. The Compliment + Question (genuine, specific)
2. The Shared Content angle (reference something they posted)
3. The Direct Value Drop (give insight before asking)

For each:
- Opening message (under 150 words)
- Follow-up if no response in 48h
- Response to: 'Not interested right now'

Rules: Never pitch in first message. Sound human, not templated.
prompts.use_case: Use for Instagram, LinkedIn, or Twitter DM outreach

prompts.title: Client Proposal Builder
prompts.description: Write a persuasive client proposal that wins projects
prompts.prompt:
Act as a business development expert. Write a winning proposal for:

Project: {{project}}
Client: {{client_name}} at {{company}}
Budget indicator: {{budget}}

Proposal structure:
1. EXECUTIVE SUMMARY (3 sentences: problem, solution, result)
2. UNDERSTANDING YOUR SITUATION
3. THE PROBLEM (reframe pain into dollars/time lost)
4. PROPOSED SOLUTION
5. PROCESS & TIMELINE (phases, milestones, deliverables)
6. INVESTMENT (3 package options: good/better/best)
7. WHY US (2-3 proof points)
8. NEXT STEPS (specific, dated CTA)
9. FAQ (3-5 objections preemptively answered)

Tone: Confident and consultative. Write like you've already won.
prompts.use_case: Use for any service-based project proposal

prompts.title: Discovery Call Script
prompts.description: Run discovery calls that qualify leads and lead naturally to proposals
prompts.prompt:
Act as a sales coach. Create a complete discovery call script for selling {{service}} to {{target}}.

Call duration: {{duration}} minutes

Script sections:
[0-2 min] OPENER & AGENDA SETTING
[2-7 min] RAPPORT QUESTIONS (3 questions)
[7-18 min] DISCOVERY (8 questions covering: situation, pain depth, consequences, what they've tried, ideal outcome, timeline, budget, decision process)
[18-25 min] PRESENT SOLUTION (briefly, 20% of call)
[25-30 min] CLOSE & NEXT STEPS

For each question: the question + what to listen for + how to probe deeper
5 common objections with word-for-word responses
prompts.use_case: Use as your framework for every new prospect conversation

prompts.title: Follow-Up Sequence Builder
prompts.description: Write follow-up sequences for leads who went quiet
prompts.prompt:
Act as a sales strategist. Write a follow-up sequence for a prospect who {{last_interaction}} about {{service}}.

Days since last contact: {{days_since}}

6-touch sequence:
Touch 1: Value add, no ask
Touch 2: Case study (thought you'd find this relevant)
Touch 3: New angle, address likely objection
Touch 4: Direct (still exploring options?)
Touch 5: Urgency (real reason timing matters now)
Touch 6: Breakup (I'll stop ‚Äî but before I do)

For each touch: channel, subject line if email, message body (under 100 words), best time to send.

Make each touch feel fresh.
prompts.use_case: Use for prospects who went cold after initial interest

prompts.title: Objection Handling Playbook
prompts.description: Master responses to every common sales objection
prompts.prompt:
Act as a sales coach. Write an objection handling playbook for {{service}} at {{price_point}}.

For each of 8 objections, provide:
- Word-for-word response (under 60 words)
- Real objection beneath the stated one
- Follow-up question to keep conversation open
- When to hold firm vs. flex

Objections:
1. Too expensive
2. Need to think about it
3. Need to talk to partner/team
4. Tried something similar before
5. Can do it myself / have in-house
6. Not ready yet
7. Can you do it cheaper?
8. Send me more information

Bonus: 3 preemptive objection killers.
prompts.use_case: Use to train yourself on handling any sales resistance

prompts.title: LinkedIn Outreach Campaign
prompts.description: Build a multi-touch LinkedIn outreach campaign for B2B leads
prompts.prompt:
Act as a LinkedIn sales strategist. Design a 4-week outreach campaign targeting {{ideal_client}} for {{service}}.

Week 1: Connection phase
- Connection request note (under 300 chars)
- Day 3 thank you message (value-only)
